Trial_Design.evidence: Patients (N=383) undergoing SAVR (41% received concomitant CABG) enrolled in a randomized trial

Intervention.evidence: enrolled in a randomized trial of embolic protection devices

Objective.evidence: Here we assess the impact of post-operative stroke and delirium on these health outcomes in SAVR patients at 90 days.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Outcomes included 90-day functional status, neurocognitive decline from pre-surgical baseline, and quality of life (QoL).

Result_Outcome.evidence: At day 90, stroke patients were more likely to have a modified Rankin score >2 (OR 5.9;95% CI 1.7–20.1;p=0.01), depression (OR 5.3;95% CI 1.6–17.3;p=0.006), a lower 12-Item Short Form Survey (SF-12) physical health score (adjusted mean difference −3.3±1.9;p=0.08) and neurocognitive decline (OR 7.8;95% CI 2.3–26.4;p=0.001).
